body:
Comment 3 by **xavier.mehaut**: 
thanks for this complete answer ; when i encountered the pb i thought to two scenari :
- the Superclasse reference into Souclasse was a kind of macro substitution, in that
case i had no need 
to allocate Superclasse
- i had to allocate Superclasse and i thought (i don t why then) that the way to do it
was cl.superclasse = 
&scl. that was not working (i put superclasse instead of Superclasse)

thanks the correction; maybe to be put in the documentation in the "how to simulate
class hierarchy"
best regards
